place.name: LLANRHEITHAN
place.gazetteerText: LLANRITHAN, or LLANRHIDIAN, a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke; on the river Solva, 7½ miles NE by E of St. David's, and 11 NW of Haverfordwest r. station. Post town, Solva, under Haverfordwest. Acres, 1,719. Real property, £1,307. Pop., 188. Houses, 36. The land is fertile. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £86. Patrons, the Vicars Choral of St. David's. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
